p: The present study demonstrates strong antimicrobial activity of zerumbone against the cariogenic agent S. mutans (MIC = 250 μg/mL). according to the following classification of antimicrobial action: strong = 50 < MIC< 500 μg/mL moderate = MIC 600 < MIC< 1500 μg/mL and; weak = MIC> 1500 μg/mL [ 27, 28]. Our data therefore brings to light a new possibility of prophylactic and therapeutic strategies for S. mutans infection, especially in case of tooth decay, a serious public health issue [ 29].
